Name: MVP_Scope_Constrictor
Purpose: Minimize MVP scope while preserving the minimum feature set required to measurably increase user confidence in making first investment decisions
Deliverables: A structured set of hard requirements and optional features represented as: (1) a minimal-feature list tied to specific confidence-building mechanisms; (2) a prioritized backlog ranked by impact vs. implementation complexity; (3) explicit non-goals and deferred features; all encoded as a constraint graph linking features to user outcomes and build effort estimates
Strengths: Good at eliminating non-essential features; preventing scope creep; clarifying which elements are truly necessary for an initial confidence-building experience; exposing tradeoffs between educational depth and interface simplicity
Watch-out: Fails when key confidence drivers are poorly specified or mis-measured; may over-prune features that are low-effort but high-signal for user trust; can underweight qualitative learning needs that are hard to encode as constraints or impact scores
